activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Housner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$600 fine plus costs.

Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Treatment Court Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:13 PM Defendant Daniel R Housner in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jane Ellen Bucher in court for Daniel R Housner. Attorney Bucher provides the court with the plea questionnaire. Attorney Bucher informs the court of the joint agreement of an imposed and stayed sentenced of 18 month confinement with 24 month extended supervision stayed for 3 yr probation, 6 month conditional time, successful completion of treatment court. Court colloquy. Defendant enters a NC plea. Parties speak. DH speaks.

Court orders imposes 3.5 prison sentence (18 months IN and 24 months EX) stayed for:

3 years probation. 

IID upon relicensing for 3 years


Conditions of probation: 
Participate and successfully complete treatment court.
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent. Obey rules and regulations of the department. 
$600 plus costs.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

Conditional jail time:
6 months - Conditional jail time with work release
Report today to RCSD.

22TR214 and 213 - Dismissed per motion of the State. Court dismisses.

2:33 PM Defendant Daniel R Housner in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jane Ellen Bucher in court for Daniel R Housner. NG entered. Atty. Bucher requests resolution date; working to get Def into treatment court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
From Richland County Treatment Court

11:06 AM Defendant Daniel R Housner in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jane Ellen Bucher in court for Daniel R Housner. Attorney Bucher provides the court with a preliminary hearing waiver. Court finds probable cause and binds this case over.
Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Same conditions as the original $10,000 cash bond (no drink/test on demand/no bars). Amount reduced to $5000.

1:21 PM Defendant Daniel R Housner in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jane Ellen Bucher in court for Daniel R Housner. Attorney Bucher waives the formal reading. Attorney Bucher asks for a preliminary hearing and waives the time limits. DH concurs. Attorney Bucher asks to speak about bail. Attorney Bucher asks that the bond to be reduce to $5,000 cash bond. State objects to modify for bond. Attorney Bucher adds additional comments. Court asks about all bond conditions. Attorney Bucher asks the demand for blood, breath or urine on demand of law enforcement only be done on suspicions. Attorney Harper comments. Court amends to $5,000 cash bond but keeps all conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
